alert.note: Alert for Dawes; North Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 10 at 2:48AM CST until January 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below zero. * WHERE...In Nebraska, Dawes County and Northern Sioux County. In Wyoming, Converse County Lower Elevations and Niobrara County. Additional areas could be added to this Wind Chill Watch at a later forecast update. * WHEN...From Friday evening through late Saturday evening. This ending time could be extended into later portions of the weekend at a later forecast update * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Exposed animals in the agricultural, farming, and ranching communities should have a plan to keep animals protected during this weekend.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
